locations: Texas but moved to Utah for school
Denver, Colorado and moved to the Utah Valley for school
Michigan and came to Utah to help his dad take care of his mom
New Mexico but moved to Provo to live with [PossessivePronoun] best friend
degrees: Public Relations with hopes of becoming a motivational speaker
Animation at BYU with hopes to become an animator at Pixar
occupations: janitor at a local high school
regional manager of a paper company
programmer for a web design company
pastor for a local non-denominational Christian church
fishing guide on the Provo river

religious-backgrounds.description: in an atheist family, but due to some personal experiences, feels as if there might be some type of Divine Being
in a Christian home with little activity within his religion
never discussing religion in [PossessivePronoun] home
believing in God but only attends church with her grandma
without much religious experience, but has made a lot of friends who are members of the Church while attending school
Catholic but would consider [ObjectPronoun]self to be agnostic right now
without religion in the home, but has always been curious about God
in a dysfunctional family that had little to no belief in God, or believed in a harsh deity
in a community where religion was very polarized, and [SubjectPronoun] struggles with wanting to be a part of religion after having bad experiences from [PossessivePronoun] adolescence
with little religion in her house, but [PossessivePronoun] grandma is an active Catholic who takes [PossessivePronoun] to mass when she visits
in a family that always encouraged a belief in God, but never attended one church consistently
non-religious, but has taken some world-religion classes in college
without any religion in the home. For most of [PossessivePronoun] life, [SubjectPronoun] has never had any interest in spiritual things
Catholic, and went to church only on Christmas and Easter
in a nontraditional family thatwas very focused on spirituality and connecting with the inner being through meditation and nature
beliving in God, but never went to church growing up. [SubjectPronoun] has a strong belief in prayer
Christian, and reads the Bible frequently
in no particular religion, but is very spiritual and feels very close to God
Christian, and frequently attends a local non-denominational church
to be very religious, leads a local Bible study group
Catholic
Buddhist, and considers [ObjectPronoun]self very spiritual
Christian, but rarely went to church
atheist, and has no experience with spiritual things
Lutheran, and has a strong belief in Christ and the Bible
Christian, and frequently attends a local non-denominational church
without any religion in the home, but is open to learning more about religion
Christian, but lost [PossessivePronoun] faith in God as a teenager
Christian, but stopped going to church when they left home for college
without any particular religious beliefs, and currently considers [ObjectPronoun]self agnostic (doesn't know if God exists or not
believing in Christ because [SubjectPronoun] was taught to as [SubjectPronoun] grew up

desires.description: is having a difficult time in life and is looking for ways to find greater peace, joy, and purpose in life
wants to learn more about what makes the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints different from other Christian churches
is meeting with the missionaries because of encouragment from a friend who is a member of the Church
believes that meeting with the missionaries will help [ObjectPronoun] to be a more spiritual and righteous person
is looking to develop a more personal relationship with God
is looking for a church to attend
has many friends who are members of the church, and wants to study the church to learn more about why these friends always seem so happy
has recently lost a loved one, and is looking for ways to find peace during this difficult time
is wondering if there is a higher power and if it can benefit [ObjectPronoun]
wants to grow closer to God and find purpose in life
has been questioning whether God exists and would like a fresh perspective
looking to grow closer to God and to know that God knows [ObjectPronoun], listens to [ObjectPronoun], and cares about [ObjectPronoun] and [PossessivePronoun] family
hopes that the missionaries can help [ObjectPronoun] grow a relationship with God
has been very stressed out with school and feels like [PossessivePronoun] life has no purpose or direction. [SubjectPronoun] is hoping to change that by meeting with the missionaries
really enjoyed [PossessivePronoun] first meeting with the missionaries (the Restoration) and felt good about the Book of Mormon when [SubjectPronoun] prayed about it
has been taught the first two lessons so far, and accepted everything in those lessons. [SubjectPronoun] felt good about the Book of Mormon when [SubjectPronoun] prayed about it
was baptized in another church as a baby. [SubjectPronoun] has met with you two times so far, and has been progressing really quickly
has recently lost [PossessivePronoun] job and is struggling to make ends meet, and hopes the missionaries can bring some additional joy into [PossessivePronoun] life
met the missionaries while they were out knocking doors, and was curious about their message. [SubjectPronoun] is a little hesitant to meet with them, but is willing to give it a chance

loves learning about other religions, and called out to the missionaries one day as they were riding their bikes past [PossessivePronoun] house. [SubjectPronoun] invited them to come over in a few days for a lesson (which is today)

is married, and both [SubjectPronoun] and [PossessivePronoun] [Spouse] are social drinkers. One of [Name]'s favorite ways to relax is to watch football with a six pack of beer. You have already taught both [Name] and [PossessivePronoun] the first 3 lessons, and they have been to church 2 times with their kids
harbors feelings of resentment towards God because of difficult trials in [PossessivePronoun] life, but is willing to give religion and spirituality another try
is dating a member of the Church, and this has led to several gospel discussions, which eventually led to [ObjectPronoun] accepting an invitation to meet with the missionaries

was recently diagnosed with cancer. When [SubjectPronoun] find out about the cancer, [SubjectPronoun] went to [PossessivePronoun] for help. The pastor told [ObjectPronoun] that it was a result of God being displeased with [ObjectPronoun]. Fortunately, [Name] will likely recover from the cancer, but this experience caused [ObjectPronoun] to visit several other churches of different faiths, but none of them have felt right yet

grew up farming corn on [PossessivePronoun] parent’s farm but [PossessivePronoun] parents just recently got divorced and [SubjectPronoun] is worried about the effect the divorce is having on [PossessivePronoun] younger siblings. [SubjectPronoun] wants to know what [PossessivePronoun] individual purpose in life is as well as some clarity about what is going on with [PossessivePronoun] family. [Name] wants to feel a stronger connection to God and know what [SubjectPronoun] can do to make sure that [SubjectPronoun] has a better family in the future

has hit a bit of a rough patch in life right now with all the crazy things happening in the world and is looking for some of that happiness. [SubjectPronoun] talked to [PossessivePronoun] friend about it and the friend suggested [Name] meet with the missionaries. [SubjectPronoun] is hoping to learn how to be a better Christian so that [SubjectPronoun] can get through hard times

started experiencing some trials in [PossessivePronoun] teenage years that caused [ObjectPronoun] to turn to drugs and alcohol. [Name] has a lot of guilt and sadness because of some of [PossessivePronoun] past decisions, and is hoping the missionaries can help [ObjectPronoun] overcome this gulit and find greater happiness in life
has been taught the first 3 lessons so far and is excited about [PossessivePronoun] baptism coming up next month. [SubjectPronoun] does not drink or smoke, but drinks coffee every morning

met [PossessivePronoun] [Partner] the beginning of her sophomore year and they fell in love. They are happily living together until they finish college and then plan to move to California together. [Name] has been meeting with the missionaries for a few weeks because [SubjectPronoun] was doing research on religion in the area for a journalism class and came across the church website where [SubjectPronoun] requested a book of mormon. The missionaries brought it to [ObjectPronoun] door and invited [ObjectPronoun] to learn more. [SubjectPronoun] is really liking what [SubjectPronoun] is learning and has been to church once in the YSA ward. [SubjectPronoun] has also made some friends there. [PossessivePronoun] [Partner] is supportive but not interested. You have taught [ObjectPronoun] lessons 1-3 and [SubjectPronoun] liked them and wants to keep learning. [SubjectPronoun] also loves to read the book of mormon and tells you that [SubjectPronoun] feels that it's true
is trying to find [PossessivePronoun] purpose in life outside of track and field and school
is hoping to gain an understanding of the purpose of life (if there is one) and what that would mean to [ObjectPronoun]

has family who are members of the Church, so [SubjectPronoun] has learned a bit about the religion but is conflicted about [PossessivePronoun] beliefs. [SubjectPronoun] wants to figure all this out so [SubjectPronoun] and [PossessivePronoun] [Partner] can ground themselves on similar beliefs
recieved a priesthood blessing from a friend and now [SubjectPronoun] wants to learn more
wants to know if God really does exist and how that affects [ObjectPronoun]
is trying to figure out if religion works for [ObjectPronoun] and for [PossessivePronoun] future
is meeting with the missionaries due to encouragement from [PossessivePronoun] [Partner]
struggles to understand why bad things happen to good people
believes in being a good person and wants to have God more in [PossessivePronoun] life but isn't sure organized religion is what [SubjectPronoun] wants
often worries that God is disappointed in [ObjectPronoun] for not following him better and wants to know how to change
recently went through some physically and emotionally traumatic experiences that have left [ObjectPronoun] questioning and wondering what God's true nature is
likes reading the Bible and talking about it
